text: What is the supreme law of the Philippines?
explanation: The 1987 Philippine Constitution is the highest law of the land; all laws must conform to it.

text: Which branch of government is tasked to execute and implement laws?
explanation: The Executive Branch, headed by the President, enforces and implements the laws.

text: The power of judicial review belongs to which government body?
explanation: The Supreme Court interprets laws and determines whether acts of the government are constitutional.

text: How many years is the term of office of the President of the Philippines?
explanation: The President serves a single 6-year term without re-election.

text: The Bill of Rights is found in which Article of the 1987 Constitution?
explanation: Article III contains the Bill of Rights, which protects the fundamental liberties of individuals.

text: Who has the power to declare martial law?
explanation: The President may declare martial law but is subject to review by Congress and the Supreme Court.

text: The right to due process and equal protection of the law is guaranteed under which section of the Bill of Rights?
explanation: Section 1 of Article III guarantees due process and equal protection.

text: Who presides over the Senate?
explanation: The Senate President leads and presides over sessions in the Senate.

text: Who has the exclusive power to initiate impeachment cases?
explanation: The House of Representatives initiates all impeachment cases, while the Senate conducts the trial.

text: Which of the following is NOT a qualification to become a Senator?
explanation: A Senator must be at least 35 years old. The age 25 requirement applies to members of the House of Representatives.

text: How many Senators compose the Senate of the Philippines?
explanation: The Senate is composed of twenty-four (24) Senators elected at large by the qualified voters of the Philippines.

text: Sa ilalim ng Bill of Rights, ang karapatan ng isang tao na manahimik (right to remain silent) at magkaroon ng abogado ay kinikilala sa anong yugto?

options.text: Sa ilalim ng kustodiya o 'custodial investigation'

explanation: Ang karapatang ito (Miranda Rights) ay dapat ibigay sa sinumang taong sinisiyasat para sa paggawa ng krimen habang nasa kustodiya ng pulisya o 'custodial investigation'.

text: The appointments made by the President, such as the heads of executive departments and ambassadors, must be confirmed by which body?
explanation: The Commission on Appointments (CA), composed of members from both the Senate and the House of Representatives, is mandated to approve or reject key appointments made by the President.

text: What is the maximum number of consecutive terms a Member of the House of Representatives is allowed to serve?

options.text: Three consecutive terms of three years each
Two consecutive terms of four years each
Three consecutive terms of four years each

explanation: A Representative can serve a maximum of three consecutive three-year terms. After a break, they may run again.

text: Ayon sa Artikulo II, Seksyon 1 ng Konstitusyon, saan nakasalalay ang kapangyarihan (sovereignty) ng isang estado?
explanation: Ang probisyong ito ay nagsasaad na 'Ang Pilipinas ay isang estadong republikano at demokratiko. Ang ganap na kapangyarihan ay nakasalalay sa sambayanan at nagmumula sa kanila ang lahat ng awtoridad ng pamahalaan.'

text: What is the primary function of the Legislative Branch (Congress) in the Philippine government?
explanation: The Legislative Branch, composed of the Senate and the House of Representatives, is primarily responsible for lawmaking.

text: The power of the State to take private property for public use upon payment of just compensation is known as:
explanation: Eminent Domain is the governmentâ€™s inherent power to take or authorize the taking of private property for public use, provided that just compensation is paid.

text: The term of office for Senators of the Philippines is:

options.text: Six years, eligible for one immediate re-election
Six years, eligible for a maximum of two consecutive terms
Four years, eligible for one immediate re-election

explanation: Senators serve for six years and can be re-elected for only one consecutive term, totaling a maximum of 12 consecutive years.

text: Which principle limits the powers of the government by dividing them among the legislative, executive, and judicial branches?
explanation: Separation of Powers divides the government's functions into three distinct branches. The principle of Checks and Balances allows each branch to curb the power of the others.

text: The rule against double jeopardy protects an accused person from being:

options.text: Tried and convicted in two different countries for the same offense
Punished twice for the same act, regardless of acquittal or conviction
Charged and acquitted or convicted twice for the same offense

explanation: Double jeopardy means a person cannot be subjected to prosecution for the same offense after being validly acquitted or convicted.

text: Under the 1987 Constitution, how can a law enacted by Congress be overturned or declared void?

options.text: By a majority vote of the Senate
By an Executive Order from the President
By the Supreme Court exercising its power of judicial review

explanation: The Supreme Court, through judicial review, has the final authority to determine the constitutionality of any law, treaty, or executive agreement.

text: The constitutional right to 'form unions, associations, or societies for purposes not contrary to law' is a component of which general right?
explanation: The freedom of association is usually coupled with the right to peaceably assemble and petition the government for redress of grievances.

text: The power of the purse, which refers to the authority to approve the national budget, belongs exclusively to which branch of government?
explanation: The Congress (Legislative Branch) has the sole authority to appropriate funds for the operation of the government.

text: Which of the following is NOT an impeachable officer under the 1987 Constitution?

options.text: The Secretary of the Department of Finance

explanation: Only the President, Vice-President, Members of the Supreme Court, Members of the Constitutional Commissions, and the Ombudsman are impeachable officers.

text: The writ that protects the right to life, liberty, and security of persons whose freedom is under threat due to illegal means is the:
explanation: The Writ of Amparo is a judicial remedy protecting a person's rights to life, liberty, and security, specifically against extrajudicial killings and enforced disappearances.

text: Which Constitutional Commission is tasked with enforcing and administering all laws and regulations relative to the conduct of elections?
explanation: The Commission on Elections (COMELEC) is one of the three Constitutional Commissions and is responsible for elections.

text: The State's policy to 'afford full protection to labor, local and overseas, organized and unorganized' is enshrined in which article of the Constitution?

options.text: Article II (Declaration of Principles and State Policies)
Article XIII (Social Justice and Human Rights)

options.d: Article XIV (Education, Science and Technology, Arts, Culture, and Sports)

explanation: Labor protection and social justice are primarily detailed under Article XIII.

text: In the absence of a search warrant or warrant of arrest, which of the following instances allows a police officer to legally search or arrest a person?

options.text: The person is a known political activist
The person is acting suspiciously in a private residence
The person has just committed, is committing, or is about to commit an offense in the officer's presence (in flagrante delicto)
The officer suspects the person is carrying illegal drugs

explanation: Warrantless arrests and searches are generally valid if the person is caught in the act of committing a crime (in flagrante delicto).

text: The phrase 'No person shall be held to answer for a criminal offense without due process of law' primarily protects the right to:

options.text: Trial by an impartial judge and jury
Procedural fairness in judicial and administrative proceedings

explanation: Due process ensures that every legal action against a person follows established rules and principles, guaranteeing procedural fairness.

text: What is the maximum period the President can initially declare martial law?
explanation: The initial proclamation of martial law cannot exceed sixty (60) days, unless extended by Congress.

text: The principle of separation of Church and State is specifically mentioned in which Article of the Constitution?
explanation: Article II, Section 6 states: 'The separation of Church and State shall be inviolable.'

text: The 'Non-impairment of contracts' clause means that the State cannot pass a law that:

options.text: Prevents any business from operating in the Philippines
Changes the existing obligations of a contract between private parties
Prevents citizens from entering into any contract

explanation: The non-impairment clause generally prohibits the government from changing the terms of valid private contracts already in existence.

text: Ang kapangyarihan ng 'Gubernatorial Veto' ay nagpapahintulot sa Gobernador na tanggihan ang isang ordinansa na ipinasa ng Sangguniang Panlalawigan. Aling prinsipyo ito ng Konstitusyon ang nagpapahintulot nito?
explanation: Ang kapangyarihan ng Veto ay isang anyo ng Checks and Balances, kung saan ang Ehekutibo (Gobernador/Pangulo) ay maaaring tutulan ang desisyon ng Lehislatura (Sangguniang Panlalawigan/Kongreso).

text: Which Article of the 1987 Constitution contains the provisions related to the Accountability of Public Officers, including the creation of the Ombudsman?

options.d: Article XIII (Social Justice and Human Rights)

explanation: Article XI is dedicated to ensuring accountability, covering impeachment and the Office of the Ombudsman.

text: The power of the President to suspend the privilege of the writ of habeas corpus may be done only in cases of:

options.text: Imminent threats of war or trade disputes
Invasion or rebellion, when public safety requires it
Natural disasters or major public health crises

explanation: The Constitution strictly limits the power to suspend the writ or declare martial law to the conditions of invasion or rebellion.
